section.title: void CubeController.Cube.BresenhamsLine3D (int x1, int y1, int z1, int x2, int y2, int z2, bool setting)
section.emphasis: <summary> This is an attempt to characterize Bresenham's Line Algorithm in 3D, extrapolating information from the 2D version. A 3D implementation has been modified from its source: https://www.ict.griffith.edu.au/anthony/info/graphics/bresenham.procs
section.para: Basic idea in 2D: Let A = 2 times change in B Let B = A - 2 times change in A Let M = A - change in A
Set the starting point.
Then, for every position along A: while (!atEnd): M < 0 new pixel on same line as last pixel; M += A; M >= 0 new pixel on line higher than last pixel; M += B;
